name: Avoid thread injection
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target library loading
description:
Using CAST data-flow engine, this quality rule detects paths from user input methods down to thread sleep/timeout APIs, identifying vulnerabilities where externally-controlled input directly influences thread execution timing.
The rule searches for data flows from:
-User input sources
-To thread control methods
output:
List all methods that make resource calls forged by user input

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from user input source down to the target file path command method.
rationale:
The software allows user-controlled input to directly specify thread sleep durations or timeout values. This creates an uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability where attackers can manipulate application performance and availability.
Consequences:
-Denial of service (DoS): attackers can force threads to sleep for excessive periods (hours, days, or even indefinitely)
-Resource exhaustion: in multi-threaded applications, all available threads can be made to sleep simultaneously, blocking new requests
-Application unresponsiveness: critical application functions become unavailable to legitimate users
-Performance degradation: even moderate sleep values can severely impact application throughput
-Economic impact: service unavailability leads to business disruption and potential revenue loss
This vulnerability is particularly critical in:
-Web applications where each request consumes a thread from a limited pool
-Real-time systems where timing precision is essential
-High-throughput services where performance is business-critical
reference:
CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/400.html

CWE-383: J2EE Bad Practices: Direct Use of Threads
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/383.html

Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP)  Top ten - Injection category
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10-2017_A1-Injection
https://owasp.org/Top10/A03_2021-Injection/

CISQ: ASCSM-CWE-078
remediation:
Primary recommendation: never allow user input to directly control thread sleep durations.
If timing control is required:
-Input validation with strict bounds: define maximum acceptable values (e.g., 1-5 seconds maximum)
-Use predefined values: map user input to a limited set of acceptable durations
-Implement timeouts: set overall operation timeouts regardless of sleep duration
-Rate limiting: limit how frequently timing operations can be called per user/session
alternativeName: Ensure your application does not process thread with unsanitized stream
